This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
There are many excellent opportunities in this issue - including several highlighted
below. The mid-winter recess next week is a very good time to explore and apply to
various spring & summer programs – students should take advantage of this time off
and apply to any preferred opportunities. Remember that it is fine to apply to and be
accepted by several different programs – you can then just pick the one(s) that are
your best fit and decline the others (in a timely way).
And please note that many programs have March 1st application deadlines!
EVENTS: All students may attend the in-person Community Board 14 Youth
Programs Summer Fair on March 6th – the focus is on programs for that borough,
but some citywide options will be represented as well. And the NY Hall of Science in
Queens offers a Resume/Cover Letter Workshop on 2/20 – open to all students
(along with their free STEM Night on 2/22, which will cover A.I. and other
innovative Tech developments).
BUSINESS/JOBS: The NYC Votes paid internship is accepting applications from
all students until February 23rd.
LEADERSHIP/LAW/GOVERNMENT: Service in Schools is a free leadership
training program for current 9th, 10th, and 11th graders, scheduled for the April school
vacation break – participants learn to develop successful community initiatives. The
Sadie Nash summer leadership program for all female and gender-expansive
students is now online. And the KACE Grassroots Internship program for 9th, 10th,
and 11th graders offers training on public campaigns to help NYC neighborhoods, with
as focus on the Korean-American community – all may apply.
STEM: A new MIT Beaver Works spring online set of courses is open to all
freshmen & sophomores – the application deadline is February 21st! They also offer
the free, one-week LL Cipher Cybersecurity summer in-person program on the MIT
campus – students must provide their own residential & transportation arrangements.
And current juniors may apply for their two-week LL Rise Engineering/Radar
Technology in-person summer program.
The Bloomberg Company welcomes applications for its paid summer Software
Engineering High School Internship, for students with prior programming language
skills – the application deadline is February 23rd!
And the May 4th in-person Perry Initiative event at NYU Langone Hospital in
Manhattan is now accepting applications from all female or gender-expansive
sophomores & older who are interested in medicine & healthcare careers – spots are
limited.
THEATER/PERFORMING ARTS: The free Summer Arts Institute at Frank Sinatra
High School in Astoria has extended its application deadline to 2/23 – 9th, 10th, and
11th graders interested in music, dance, theater, art, and other performance arts may
apply.
